SENT.plain: Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) was applied to detect the structural change accompanying the activation of oncogenes in hematological malignancies and preleukemic states
Point mutation of N-ras oncogene was examined by oligonucleotide differential hybridization coupled with PCR
Five out of 17 AML patients were shown to have mutated N-ras gene
These mutations could be used as a genetic marker to diagnose the residual malignant cells
Philadelphia chromosome in CML was examined by cDNA synthesis and PCR with successful results
PCR was shown to be a highly versatile and sensitive method which would be invaluable in clinical diagnosis
